page.title: 03Knebworth Primary School
page.content: Knebworth Primary School is sited in Swangleys Lane near the junction with London Road. It is one of the largest village primary schools in the country with 360 children between the ages of 4 1/2 and 11 years. The main part of the building was built in 1912 and a new infant block of four classes was added in 1983. A further extension is planned for later this year.The school has a heated outdoor swimming pool. The Head teacher has 12 full-time teachers working with him. Four part-time teachers help with music and one other helps with reading. Two welfare assistants help the teachers and children in many ways. The school kitchen cooks 190 school dinners every day and also cooks dinners for "Meals on Wheels" for the elderly. 166 children bring packed lunches to school every day.
